Reviews.Title: “Good location, certain lacks”
Reviews.Author: fitzbenedict
Reviews.Content: Located just off the Ramblas, this hotel has a perfect location for visitors to Barcelona. You easily reach the main attractions, the beaches and has the wonderful Placa Reial next door. This hotel is gay-friendly, but most of the visitors seems to be straight. it has recently been refurbished and is not at all expensive. The staff is just wonderful and it is very clean. Among certain negative things is that you do not have a minibar in the rooms and that you can not purchase cold beverages. It is quite noisy during weekends, so you had better be someone who likes to come home late at night! Poor breakfast (included in the price): no vegetables, no fruits for instance.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 2 star hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: mingum
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great value for money in Barcelona. Some people might call it 3 stars, but it lacks certain amenities that would bring it up a star such as a restaurant, in-room safe, clock and dresser drawers, fridge in the room, good heating, for example. The rooms are small but completely sufficient and very very clean though a bit cold even though we had the heat turned up as high as possible, it never really got warm, and it wasn't very cold outside. The floors are not carpeted (which helps keep it feeling clean because carpets can get really disgusting really fast) but they were cold, more than the air - the tiles just never warmed up so you had to wear socks. The breakfast is included, which is a great savings, though it would be nice if they changed it up a bit from day to day. We were there for 8 nights and by day 4 I was wishing for at least a different type of muffin or maybe some fruit. The breakfast consists of muesli, corn flakes, glazed croissant, 2 types of sweet muffins, 3 types of bread, sliced ham, sliced cheese, jams, honey, orange & pineapple fruit drink (not real juice), hot and cold milk, coffee, tea and powdered chocolate. It was enough food to not have to eat again until the afternoon. Many people brought in their own fruit which is a good idea. Two of the three staff at the desk were very helpful and nice. The third was quite brusk and obviously annoyed when we wanted to put our stuff in and out of the safe (since there is none in the room). While it is on a side street, the streets are always so busy it felt safe walking there, and was nice to be a bit off the main street. We requested a room that faced the back, and it was very, very quiet, facing an enclosed courtyard with other apartments facing. The windows shut very nicely and kept out most sounds from outside. However we were near the elevator so we could always hear people in the hallway (especially some very rambunctious children running and running and running and jumping and running for seeming hours on end) and when they were in the bathroom in the room next door we could hear loudly all the faucets and clanking. All in all it was not bad noise, but not quiet like a tomb either. I would recommend this hotel instantly to anybody who is ok without having a very fancy place to stay, a good price in a great location right in the heart of the Gotica section and just a couple blocks from the Licea metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location - Could be better”
Reviews.Author: PVDetroit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights. The location is great, right off Las Ramblas, the hotel is clean and the front desk people are very helpful. Only two negative comments, the breakfast that comes with your stay is not very good at all and the pieces of the ceiling fell into our bathtub.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Nidex
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the 2 star status of this hotel, I have stayed in worse 4 star ones. The location of the hotel is excellent, just off las ramblas and close to all the transport connections. The rooms are clean and more than adequate, although the choice of decor might not be to everyone's taste. The bathrooms are clean and in many ways a higher standard than the rooms. The staff are excellent, efficient, friendly and they create a very welcoming atmosphere. The breakfast is fairly basic but very nice. Because of the central location there is a lot of noise outside, often into the early hours. To avoid this ask for a room on the higher floors or a internal "courtyard" room. All in all a very good hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The newly renovated Hotel California”
Reviews.Author: washbfr
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel California for many years. Last year I stayed for 2 nights before a transatlantic cruise from BCN. The new renovations are very nice the rooms are still very clean and the addition of the elevator is great! I will be back in BCN in April and will also be staying at the Hotel California. Can't beat the price! And the location is fantastic as well.

Reviews.Title: “We wouldn't wish it better!”
Reviews.Author: Gemini0306
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a friend for 5 nights from the 4th of March. Due to the most explicit explanation of the staff guys of the hotel we got to it easily and quickly from the airport, avoiding eur35-40 for a taxi. (Keep in mind booking a Barcelona Card to get it at the Tourist Agency at the airport - it will solve all the transportation headache during your stay in Barcelona!) You are just taking train from the airport to Passaige de Gracia and then a Green (no.3) metro line till Liceu station (2 stops if I remember it right). You are to take the exit "Teatr Liceu", stroll 100m on Rambla and take a left turn to Ferran str. Then look for a right turn to Rauric str 14 and here you are! Very pleasant and helpful staff, spacios room and bath-room (we lived in room 408 on the 4th floor), very clean , good breakfast - I can hardly remeber staying in a 2 star hotel of such a GOOD level. 2 minutes walk from Rambla, close to the metro. Definitely come only here again!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Dilema”
Reviews.Author: Alan H
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights last weekend, and I have the dilema whether I would recommend this hotel or not. Location is great, just off Las Ramblas, however the entrance at night can be a bit tricky as it is down a very narrow side street opposite a sex shop! Room and facilities very good.Staff, fantastic, could not be more helpful. However, the noise is a problem. First night, tired and a few San Miguels no problem. But the next 2 nights were full of interuptions from the street noise. I think because of the 2 narrow streets it is flanked by, the noise travels upwards. I think for couples who plan on staying out late or groups out for the nightlife, definatley. For families with young children, then no

Reviews.Title: “well worth it”
Reviews.Author: jcw721
Reviews.Content: stayed there last weekend for three nights thought it was terrific clean, great price, excellent central location staff were all excellent several people noted the noise -- for us this wasnt a big issue the windows are good and also tight and since it is the winter they were closed - we were on the top floor on the side the place might be noisy if youre in the front on a low floor i got up around 5 one night and opened the window and noted that there were people out partying below the place -- i couldn't hear them without the window open -- place seemed like a very good deal to us

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: wilk
Reviews.Content: Returned from our 3 night stay at the Hotel California on 31st December 2011. Had a great time there. The hotel was easy to find using the directions from a previous review (much appreciated in a busy city) as the hotel entrance is in a small alley. The room was spotless and kept clean daily, my only dissapointment was the dark grout around the bath. This let it down slightly, but there was always plenty of hot water when needed. We had room 203 and it was noisy through the night, but you are in the heart of a busy city and people are enjoying themselves! Breakfeast was perfect, enough bread, pastries, cereals, ham, cheese etc to set you up ready for your busy day ahead. Reception guys were good, always had a smile for you. Overall a brilliant stay and if I were to visit Barcelona again i wouldn't hesitate to use this hotel. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: debbs123
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 days in november with my family. excellent location, rooms clean , good breakfast and lovely staff. will definitely stay here again if i return to barcelona

Reviews.Title: “welcome to the hotel california.”
Reviews.Author: colin d
Reviews.Content: arrived 8thdec. The hotel is in a side street just off la ramblas. Clean,tidy hotel,Friendly receptionists. Room was basic but comfortable. Location is perfect to explore the city. It is onlt 2 star,but I,ve stayed in worse 3 star hotels. If your on a budget it,s ideal.We had 2 balconies and noise is not a problem,even after "Barca " beat real madrid,the atmosphere was electric but very enjoyable... We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: pinkmarch52
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean and great staff. Breakfast was good and the price was very cheap. The location is great just off Las Ramblas and soo handy .

Reviews.Title: “Hotel California - a hidden gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Chips_Chipolatas
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for 3 nights with my wife. What a great little hotel, great location (so near to La Ramblas, Plac de Catalunya and the marina areas. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The room was clean and continental breakfast a great start to the day. My wife was so impressed she is looking forward to going again to Barcelona and we will definitely stay at the Hotel California again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: shirleyanne_uk
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights in the hotel california for my husband's birthday. couldn't fault the room at all. we had 2 little balconies (e were on a corner). the sheets were spotless, the bathroom spotless, with plenty hot water. the towels were changed every day. breakfast was typical continental style with fresh bread, cheese, ham, cakes, croissants, cereals, various styles of coffee, fruit juice. the only gripe i had was that adele cd was played every morning (groannn!) i would have been nice to have a different one every day. i now can't STAND adele songs! however this was the ONLY complaint! the staff throughout the hotel were really nice and helpful. al in all we had a wonderful stay and looking forward to returning!

Reviews.Title: “Head down, then head out!”
Reviews.Author: Claire M
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I are just back from a weekend break in Barcelona. We stayed at the Hotel California and were not disappointed. Having booked the flights and hotel through Easyjet for, frankly, a song, I was slightly concerned about the accommodation. I read some earlier, fairly negative reviews on the hotel with particular regard to noise,cleanliness, and the attitude of the front desk clerks. To address these concerns in reverse order, the guys in reception were absolutely charming and couldn't do enough for us - I simply couldn't fault them. As for the room, we had a twin which was spotlessly clean; the bathroom was sparkling and the sheets had been brutally laundered. Noise was not an issue - when the balcony doors were open, we enjoyed listening to the sounds from the street - isn't that part of the city experience? When we closed the doors - nothing. Breakfast was fine - bread, cheese, muffins, jams, juice and coffee (various from a machine), very filling, relaxed with nobody looking over your shoulder waiting to clear the table, which I experienced in a Hilton once. The best thing about Hotel California is that when you walk out of the front door you are immersed in the essence of Barcelona. The architecture imposes itself; you can walk to numerous galleries as we did and the opera house is across the way, (not continuous productions). You will see deprivation, homelessness and desperation around the hotel and nearby. You'll also see individuals, restaurants and officials, (police and security staff), in the immediate area and further afield, taking a wonderfully tolerant and compassionate approach to those marginalised people. If I have one gripe about the California, it's that there was no mirror in the bedroom. As a woman who MUST wash and then straighten her hair every day, I needed that. The bathroom steams up and defeats the object, plus there is no socket there anyway! Otherwise, what a wonderful place from which to explore the city? We walked to the "Touristic Bus" for a tour, (Catalunya Square), The Museum of Modern Art, The Picasso Museum and the Gaudi buildings, along with many other landmarks. The California is a great base from which to experience every aspect of life in Barcelona, as long as you're happy with living briefly in an alley. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, hotel in the heart of Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: molebert
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel California for a couple of days before flying out of Barcealona after a conerfence outside of town. Everything people have posted about the helpfulness of the front desk staff is true. I was there during a festival, when it was difficult to get taxis/buses downtown, and they were very helpful providing suggestions about how to get to the airport. My room was small but spotless- a perfect base for exploring Barcelona. It is a bit difficult to find- but if you read other posts you will be fine. Our taxi couldn't get as close as usually because of all the festival related traffic, and we had to search for a bit- but it is literally right off of a main shopping street, and near a subway stop. The breakfast buffet is very generous for a complimentary breakfast, so I encourage you to take advantage of it. It is in a basement room that reminds me of a subway tunnel that had undergone a makeover show. I think there must have been lots of recent renos- lots of touches I wouldn't have chosen for my own home (e.g. Lighting in shower), but there was much more effort into mood/styling than you would typically find in a hotel in this price range. I felt quite safe staying there as a woman traveling alone, and didn't find the street/ neighborhood dangerous at all (as I read in some other reviews).

Reviews.Title: “Fab little hotel”
Reviews.Author: karencatgirl
Reviews.Content: Arrived 21st October, not sure what to expect. William (Guilermo) at desk so nice and helpfull, rooms spotless and location could not be better - we have stayed in more expensive hotels in barca and not felt so safe and comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. all reception staff very helpful with info on transport etc and also had a sense of humour when my sister flipped out one morning about clean towels!! ( an oversight which was quickly corrected). hope to be back soon. karen ferguson - glasgow

Reviews.Title: “Top location”
Reviews.Author: fitzbenedict
Reviews.Content: This hotel has one big advantage and that is the location. That is my principa reason for staying there. If you like the old town, please stay here, because you reach every part in a couple of minutes. And if you like to have a coffee, a cocktail at the Plaza Mayor, it is very near. As everywhere in the old town, it is quite noisy, so please ask for a room which has a window to the courtýard. I could not say that the breakfast is so good. I have stayed here a couple of times and the breakfast was worse before the refurbishment... The overall impression is very good and I think the service is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: AlanTarvit
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 nights at the hotel and overall was very pleased, only one bad point which I will get to at the end of review. i booked the hotel after reading trip advisors reviews, my wife was a bit hesitant but even she was pleased with the standard of rooms and the cleanliness of the whole place. As mentioned in other reviews the hotel is just off Las Ramblas and very easy to find. I did not find it noisy at night and I am a light sleeper. beds were vey comfortable and toilet was immaculate, clean towels every day which you do not get in some more exoensive hotels. Yes there is no view, our room was on the alley with a small balcony, ideal just for going out to have a quick ciggie rather than go down to front door to have one in the street. We were on 4th floor, very good double glazing which kept noise away. Breakfast was okay, choice of a couple of cold drinks, various coffees out machine (but good), crousants, rolls, cheese, ham, jams, cakes, 2 different cereals but not much more but adequate to get you started for the day ahead. A lot of hotels I looked at did not provide a breakfast at all. Now for the very good and the very bad:- The hotel was manned 24 hours to let residents in and out which was a very good safety feature, one of the clerks on the desk was very polite and helped us enourmously with travel questions and recommending some very good restaraunts, he was a credit to the hotel, another chap (did not get his name but had the look of the type that always had the unshaven look, he did not make much comments when he let you in our out but on our last day he was very rude. We came back to collect our luggage which they kindly look after for you if you are a late flight. When we came to ask for it, not knowing any spanish my wife just said "cases" meaning where do we get them and he just lost the plot " Cases what you mean cases? blah blah blah (in spanish) rant rant rant" If I was the owner of the hotel and heard this I would have sacked him on the spot. Apart from that read other reviews but as far as we were concerned, I would go back as it is good accommodation price wise compared to others in less prominent locations, metro station 2 mins away and you could walk from hotel to many of the sights, I would recommend getting a 2 day ticket for the hop on/off Touistic bus, good audio of places you pass and lets you decide where you would like to go and see later, three diffwrent routes and you could see practically the whole of the city. Point to remember, no ketle or fridge in room but caused us no problem, good air con.

Reviews.Title: “A value for the area with a nice friendly staff but too loud for me personally”
Reviews.Author: Weingradesq
Reviews.Content: I have to say everyone at the Hotel California was very considerate and helpful. The breakfast was enough to get the day started. I felt safe in the area (even though it's on an alley) and the door was always locked at night so the person staffing the desk controlled who came into the hotel. It was VERY easy to find once the airport bus drops you off at Plaza Catalunya. I have to say, despite all the positives, I could never consider staying here or anywhere near the hotel next time I am in Barcelona. It was CRAZY loud on Friday night. I was on the 4th floor and not facing the alley and I basically could not sleep all night with my window closed. No fault of the hotel - but you should know that it was also pretty loud the other nights, as well (Wed, Thrs). I am a light sleeper and it was a bad fit for me personally. So I will rate it high for value, location and comfort (though the towels left much to be desired) but I don't think anyone who wishes to get a good nights rest should consider staying anywhere so close to Las Ramblas or the side streets during high season.

Reviews.Title: “Small, cramped, cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: Lakers_8
Reviews.Content: Here's the real deal people - I'm literally in this motel (not a hotel) right noq writing this from my incredibly uncomfortable bed listening to the people upstairs flush their toilet (the pipes are next to my window) and also listening to the people next door cook as well as smell their food and cigarette smoke. I do not understand the previous reviews. I truly do not think the majority of them are valid and it's probably just management/front desk clerks writing false reviews to up their overall rating. This place 100% does NOT warrant all the "Excellent" ratings. Those ratings should be reserved for clean, decently sized rooms right below places 5 star places like the Four Seasons, etc. I'm thinking Comfort Inn, Holiday Inn, etc. This place is not much better than the yuckiest hostel. The only reason I gave it 2 stars was because it has (crappy) internet, a (yucky) breakfast, and good tv channels. My complete review: thanks to the gent who left the aerobus directions a few entries before mine. I followed them to a T and got here just fine. Upon entering, first you're struck by the gaudy, Eurodisco decorating theme in the lobby and the really pretty (male) desk clerk. He spoke reasonable English, no probs with check in. opened my door and was struck by how tiny it was. Literally, probably the size of some decent bathrooms. not too much of a problem since I'm travelling single but DO NOT stay here with another person unless you want their arm in your face the entire time. A/C works fine but I opened the window because it smelled really musty in the hallway and my room. Does not have a deadbolt or safe. My window does not face the street but it does face the middle of this complex and there's literally about 5 -6 feet of distance between my window and the next building so you hear/smell everything they are doing. Bathtub caulking covered in mold. Lots of lighting though so that's good. TV channel list was varied, 3-4 English channels and I think I even caught a German channel. INTERNET IS HORRIBLE!!!!! Constantly goes in and out. Desk workers are no help. they just shrug their shoulders and give the same excuse they've been using for years (re: old reviews) and saying the internet is kind of broken. No, the real reason is that management is too cheap to upgrade their infrastructure but are doing just the minimum to make sure they can claim to offer free internet while only a handful of rooms and the lobby actually get consistant single. Breakfast- pretty lame. Very low quality but if you're not a big breakfast eater, it suffices. I don't expect a magnificent breakfast buffet so this might be good for some. As a side, I believe this hotel caters to gay couples. i'm not 100% sure but if your preference is for something a little different, be aware. And if you're gay, there's a gay bar directly across the alley so it might be your thing because you have a 1 meter distance to stagger back for the evening. I would never stay here again and the only reason I'm staying here the entire 3 nights is because it was essentially for free through my airlines frequent flier program though I will recommend they delist this hotel as it's pretty unpleasant. Bottom line: do not stay here with small children or if you need consistent internet. Stay here if you are cheap, young (lots of nearby partying) , and only want a place to sleep. Mara

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Dina256
Reviews.Content: The hotel was reently renovated and the rooms were very clean. The staff was friendly and the location was convenient - 10min walk to Placa De Cataluyna where the airport bus drops you and 2 min walk to La Ramblas. It was a little noisy on Saturday night (despite being on the 4th floor) but earplugs solved the problem. the room doesn't have a safe or mini-bar but it didn't bother us.The hotel is really good value and would reommend it to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Larsa
Reviews.Content: I first stayed in this hotel in 2006, and, after having stayed in other hotels, among which, the much overrated Hotel Curious, on Barcelona visits since, I now returned in July 2011 for no less than nine nights. The pros of this hotel are: - relaxed, friendly, helpful staff - great location in a what is yes, a busy, touristy area, but the best of the best that Barcelona has to offer is within walking distance - La Ramblas, El Raval, the entire Barri Gotic, El Born, the beach, L'Exaimple... - clean and adequately equipped rooms - nice, modern bathrooms - perfectly decent breakfast - free wifi The only con I can think of is the noise from the surrounding streets if you're in a room facing that way, but then this is true of most hotels in Barri Gotic. I actually changed from a light room on the fourth floor with a small balcony facing the street because of the noise, to a room on the third floor facing the courtyard. Hence lost the balcony as well as the light and the view, but given that the only thing you do at a hotel in BCN is sleep, this was of no importance - my new room was very quiet and I slept like a baby!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: RiverRanchTravels
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a centrally-located place that would not break the bank and we were not disappointed. While the hotel rooms are austere, they have everything you need if you are looking to use it as your base for exploring the city, which we did. Guillermo, Chris, and Jaime manned the front desk 24 hours a day and helped us with directions that were flawless. The continental breakfast each morning was just enough to start our day. We stayed here on both ends of our cruise and our first room was right off the alley - more noisy because of the nightlife in Barcelona, but for us, it was fun. We highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “stay here”
Reviews.Author: highteas
Reviews.Content: A little gem which is spotless and provides a good continental breakfast. Reception very helpful and friendly. Right in the middle of the city action area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel shame about the bad manners at the front desk.”
Reviews.Author: NeilBradley
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our 2 night stay at the Hotel California. I had read some wonderful reviews about the hotel and was ready looking forward to our stay. We walked into the front door of the hotel and the Front Desk Clerk was sitting there and did not even look up to greet us when we came in. I speak some spanish so I greet him with Hola como esta. Which he ( William) replied good and they I took out our papers to check into the hotel and put them on the counter. He then threw the booking sheets back at me and when on a rampage about coming to the desk and just slamminig down the papers and how dare we treat him like this etc, etc. I was shock but now getting my back up. I them told him I did greet him upon arrival and he had responded to me. At this point I was very upset with him and me friends finished the check in. We get up to our rooms and me friends had a small room like ours with a double and balcony and we had 2 twin so close together they could have been a double and not 2 twins. They rooms were clean, but I wanted to see if we could get a room with a balcony also. I went back down to the front desk and ask William if it was possible if we could get a twin room with a balcony. Even before he answer my question he started to greet another guest??? I then when outside to have a smoke and let him finish with this other guests and he asked me where did I think I was going? I told him to finish the converation with the other guest and I would be back in. So after 5 minutes of listening to Him tell me I could not speak to the Manager which I never asked to speak too I told him just leave the room as is and walked away. He them came around the corner yelling at me as I got onto the elevator. William is no asset to this hotel I will tell you. As far as the rest of the staff they would polite and nice to us and the breakfast was good and the hotel was clean and in a great location next to Las Ramblas. Once I go over William trying to be rude to me I did enjoy the trip to Barcelona. Would I go back to this Hotel. No because to the first interaction with William at the front desk. Working in CS myself I really think if he was workiing for me he would be out the door., Neil Cruickshank. ( Not scared to sign my name to this review)

Reviews.Title: “clean, basic, good value for money, 2* hotel”
Reviews.Author: SussexJudith
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable 4 night stay in a tiny but adequate single rooms. Excellent hairdryer in the bathroom and a Tv in the bedroom. Clean towels and complimentary shampoo etc topped up every day. Very good breakfast (my daughter highly recommends the chocolate muffins). Helpful reception staff. In a central position, couldnt ask for more for the price. I booked the flight with Easyjet and was most impressed with their online checkin facilities and baggage drop off. Also booked the hotel with Easyjet. It is very cheap and easy to get to the hotel using the aerobus. When you come out of the terminal turn to your left and walk to bus stop B (about 150yards) you can buy a single ticket for E5+ and a return for E9+. An A1 or A2 bus will take you to Placa de Catalunya. It take about 20 - 30 minutes depending on traffic. Dont worry about not getting off at the right stop as it is the final destination. When you get off the bus cross the road and keep Hard Rock Cafe on your left. Turn left and walk down La Ramblas for about 7 minutes. On the left hand side you will come to a small road on your left with McDonalds on one corner and KFC on the other, turn left here. A couple of hundred yards on your right your will see O'Hara the irish bar and you turn right here and 50 yards down on the right is the hotel. When you want to return to the airport get the A2 arebus and get off at Terminal B, also known as Termial 2 if you've booked with Easyjet. The Easyjet Terminal in fact Terminal C but get off at B and walk for 5 minutes. Its not a problem. If you like shopping Barcelona is a shoppers paradise with clothing in Zara etc being cheaper than at home. Its easy to get around, just make sure you've got comfy shoes for walking.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: GIBBOCuffley_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and I was most impressed with the location, very central to everything. It can be a bit noisy as it was on saturday night but thats what you get for staying near las rambles. The little streets around the hotel are a delight to stroll around, and the square close by had some really good restaurants. The only downside was not the fault of the hotel, more the transfer company that we booked via Travel Republic. On collection from the airport our driver could not find the way to our hotel so he dropped us off with our luggage at the bottom of las rambles and told us our hotel was just around the corner. 15 minutes later we found our hotel about half a mile away. On the day we were returning to the airport we received a call at the hotel to say that due to road closures we would have to take our luggage to a pick up point outside the Hard Rock Cafe for us to be picked up. This was another long walk and there were plenty of cars and vans on the road outside our hotel so I didn't understand the relevance of road closures. Never mind, book into the Hotel California for a good central location, but get to the hotel from the airport via the metro service that stops very near the hotel and is quicker and cheaper than by road.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MTaylorLeeds
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from 17th to 20th March with my sister. Very easy to find - we got the aerobus from the airport to Placa De Catalunya and walked down the main La Rambla street for about 5 minutes before turning left inbetween McDonalds and KFC after the Liceau metro stop, and then 2nd right (after the Irish Bar) into the hotel. I had booked a twin room but we were given a triple which possibly took away some of the room hence making the room feel smaller than it was. It was very basic but all you really need. No long mirror in the bedroom though - women will understand! :-) At night because our room was close to the main street, which contained about 5 irish bars all in a row, we did hear loud noise until about 3am every night - thankfully I had some ear plugs with me so was able to get some sleep. Other reviews had mentioned that their rooms had double glazing, unfortunately I think we may have had one of the older rooms. The free continental breakfast included in the price was also quite basic consisting of conrnflakes, muesli, croissants, 2 types of bread rolls, some cheese, ham, couple of mini muffins and a coffee/tea maker - no fruit or yoghurts. If it is cheaper to get the room without breakfast I would do that and pop into one of the bakeries located nearby or even the starbucks across the road! It filled us up till lunchtime though and is available from 7.30-10.30am each morning. Reception staff were always very pleasant and helpful letting us leave our bags with them when we checked out on the Sunday as our flight wasn't until the evening. The hotel also had free wi-fi which was a bonus - get the password from reception. So in summary - you get what you pay for with this hotel, clean, basic with a great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, clean, friendly and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: littlebits3
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to pick for your stay in the Old City of Barcelona. This central location is close to the main market, a short stroll to the port, a five minute walk to the metro - the best way to travel to the Gaudi's Park Guell (then walk back down the hill through the back streets of Barcelona). The double rooms have balconies that overlook a lane (C/ Rauric) off the busier C/Ferran (great for coffee and felafels). From the balcony you can spy Les Quinze Nits restaurant (that edges the beautiful Placa Reial) here you can eat a delicious and inexpensive meal, at linen dressed tables within a gorgeous dining room. Hotel California includes breakfast with the room price. The bathroom is spacious and sports a big bath. The double glazed balcony doors block out the weekend frivolity. You cannot fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money little gem”
Reviews.Author: flossyPembrokeshire
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel feeling a little aprehensive after reading some of the reviewes-we neednt have been! Firstly the hotel is easy to find- having been dropped off at the Placa de Catalunya by the aerobus we walked down the Ramblas (half way down you will come to the Gran Teatre del Liceu on the right hand side) turn left into Carrer de ferran walk for 2 mins and then turn right into Carrer de Rauric the hotel is on the right. We were in room 107 on the first floor which was a loveley little room with duel aspect french windows leading out onto mini balconies-room was clean with plenty of room , the bathroom had a good size shower but no bath. The breakfast was traditional continental with the usual breads/cakes/cereal/cheese/ham/coffee/tea and juices the breakfast room was in the basement in what appeared to be a converted wine cellar-very cute and clean.The staff were excellent at all times especially Cris on reception who went out of his way to be helpful and ensure your stay was a pleasant one.We were aware that previous reviews had mentioned noise- and yes we were aware of it on our first night but by the second night we didnt seem to notice it-we are after all in the heart of a busy city and staying in a traditionally built spanish building in narrow streets where noise can carry-we did not think it was an issue. The area has an abundance of bars/restaurants and shops. We ate in Sinatras which is next to the hotel- the food is good but quite expensive(75 euros for two courses and wine for 2) we also ate at Les 50 nity which is on Placa Reial one of the most popular restaurants in the city- this was really nice although if you are not there by about 7.15 be prepared for a long wait in a que across the square(60 euros for two courses and a litre!!! of Sangria). Shilling bar is a good place for a drink with good ambiance also good cheap food-2 mins from hotel.Patagonia cocktail bar on the Ramblas is a good place to sit (go up the stairs to sit in balcony seats and watch the world go by).We would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Balcony view of quiet street, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Dick_Keiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel totally exceeded any expectations. The entire building has been totally redone -- the bathroom is totally modern with an oversize bath and an excellent shower. The queen bed was perfect. In fact everything about this place can only be described as PERFECT. Its location 2 blocks off the ramblas and right by the subway stop. The staff, especially Chris, were outstanding. In summary, I was sorry to leave and move on to my next destination. I do not believe you can find a better hotel in a better location for any money in Barcelona. Dick Keiser

Reviews.Title: “above our expectations”
Reviews.Author: EJDL
Reviews.Content: We were very relieved to discover that there was (plenty of!) room at the Hotel California. I think it has been through some renovations since some of the previous comments were submitted. We found it to be an excellent value, clean, friendly, with A/C and internet and television for less than we paid for a very crappy apartment with far less amenities the night before. It's nicely decorated - kind of funky and modern but not too fancy. Perfect. Great location as it's right by Las Ramblas and lots of fun restaurants, plazas and bars. The staff, as well, was very helpful and friendly. We would definitely recommend and would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: vanillaplum1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Underwent a new renovation”
Reviews.Author: notsooriginalname
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews and was quite surprised. I just returned from spain and the hotel was clean, quite, and very comfortable. Breakfast was nice, the hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. The hotel itself is in lively neighborhood, but I was told that the new renovations included soundproof windows. The room itself was very modern in decor. My wife and I were very happy with our choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff.”
Reviews.Author: nodlew
Reviews.Content: Also enjoyed the breakfasts and will return. Should you go next door to O'Haras Irish bar, word of warning, avoid the nachos and cheese. Lead Baloon.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous Position”
Reviews.Author: photoloco
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very dangerous place and not safe. I was attacked and robbed of my camera which was held in my hand INSIDE the pocket of my jacket. I am pretty sure the attacker had been signalled to by the man who was supposedly security for the My Bar just around the corner from the Hotel California. He knew exactly what he wanted and where it was. He tried to push me to the ground and stuck his thumbnail deep into my wrist to make me let go of the camera which he grabbed and disappeared with in a second. THIS WAS WITHIN 3 FEET OF THE ENTRANCE TO THE HOTEL CALIFORNIA. The attack was recorded on the hotel CCTV but what good was that? THIS HOTEL IS IN A DANGEROUS PLACE. I would never consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic quality price hotel”
Reviews.Author: MadridTom
Reviews.Content: the hotel is in the heart of the city, so you can go anywhere walking if you want...the hotel is very clean and very nice, they renew it this year, and the people working there are so kind, always with a smile and helping us, we felt like at home...Quality price is fantastic and the breakfast is a free buffet, so it's great...I will go back for sure and i absolutely recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not again, it was like sleeping in the middle of the street”
Reviews.Author: Kelene
Reviews.Content: We spent there a nightmarish weekend. We couldn't sleep not only because of the people doing parties in the street, but also because there were parties inside other rooms!!!! The place was dirty, we saw some insects in our room, and the bed was quite uncomfortable, to say the least. We complained to the reception staff, and asked him to change our room. The recepcionist (do not remember his name, but he was bald -and also bold-) was very very rude, saying that if we want to stay in the Gothic quartier, we have to manage with noise, dirtyness, etc. So we left that same day, and stayed in a B&B. I cannot understand how it is possible to have a recepcionist like that. He bited instead of talking.

Reviews.Title: “Recepcionist is very rude...”
Reviews.Author: PoliteSpaniard
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ok but take into account the following: - Very noisy area - I could not sleep very well The recepcionist was very rude when I was asking for some tourist information.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, basic but nice.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwi_on_tour09
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights here after benicassim music festival - was great to have a hot shower and a bed, but dont think Id stay here normally. Was definatly a 2 star, but a nice hotel. Staff were amazing and very helpful. Breakfast was pretty average but enough to get you going for the day. Location is what this hotel has going for it - 100m from Las ramblas! Perhaps because of the time we went it was a bit costy for what you get..??

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: waggy
Reviews.Content: Great location, rooms just ok, room service good, staff very helpful, NO LIFT! and we were on 4th floor! it is a real hike!, ...and if you are gay....I would reccomend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not so much a bed; more an instrument of torture”
Reviews.Author: garlicdoctor
Reviews.Content: Average in every way, although not cheap. Best feature is the location , in the old Gothic area of the city. However, the room was small & dingy, with a window overlooking a dirty yard to the rear of the hotel. Worst feature by far was the bed: Long , sleepless nights spent to a cacophany of old metal springs. Waking up feeling awful, as if one had slept on a pile of bricks in a skip! Would definitely NOT go again.

Reviews.Title: “helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: jboSt_Louis_MO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 6 days. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (particularly after my pocket was picked...be careful in BCN,,,watch for the bird poop scam). They were always ready to offer us helpful information. The staff seemed to care about their job and about their clients. We were impressed. Yes the room and bathroom were small. Yes the breakfast was the same every day. But the breakfast was more than adequate and the room was comfortable and clean. This is a hotel for travelers, not for business people. My one request would be for a wider range of TV channels...7 wasn't very many! The location was excellent, near the Placa Reial, the beach, and the Ramblas. We were in earlier than some reviewers so we can add nothing about crime in the immediate area. It would have been nice to have an outside patio area within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: alexxka
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in Hotel California, BCN with my friend in summer 2008. We spent almost a week in the hotel and really enjoyed its location. It is just a few steps from Plaza Reial with nice restaurants and nightlife. It's basically directly at Ramblas so you can walk to the beach or to the sights or go anywhere you like cause there are several metro stops around. The furtniture of the hotel is a bit oudated but very clean. We got a smaller double-bed room with balcony and didn't find anything disturbing there. Breakfast was standard, more sweet stuff but if you are not extremely picky, you won't stay hungry :-) Staff at the reception was very nice and helpful. I would definitely go there again cause the location is just perfect! And I'm not talking about BCN itself ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TimCollier
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay in Barcelona for one week before we left on a Western Mediterranean Cruise. Our idea was to be close to Las Rambas and close to the Port. When we arrived, we were presented with what appeared to be a shabby hole in the wall on Carrer Rauric. It does not have an elevator. The room can only be called "Spartan". The view was of a window of the building directly across the street. The streets in the Gothic Quarter are very narrow--of course this is the atmosphere that I had wanted. The continental breakfast was fine. But, the hotel is definitely not in a safe area of the city. Walking back to the hotel at about 1 a.m. on the first night, we were 'almost' robbed by locals. The next morning, we relocated to the Hotel Axel. Much better area and still close to everything. Much better accommodations. Furthermore; during the rest of the week, not a single incident of attempted robbery. While the Hotel California is located in a very central location and the accommodations are 'acceptable', if you can afford better, chose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: DebbieBeck
Reviews.Content: We arrived before our cruise 11/7/2008 and stayed for one night and upon return stayed 11/15 and 11/16. Our dealings with the staff (in English) was prompt and truthful. They quoted the room rate in Euros and gave the total including taxes and fees. There was never a question about the rate when we arrived. So helpful and service oriented. No elevator but they carried our heavy luggage upstairs for us. We did not have problems with the noise. Enjoyed the balcony in each room we had. Very clean and safe. Front entry doors are locked at all times and they have 24 hr desk attendance. Provided a n electric jack and hair dryer. You must ask at the desk. Considering the difference in American hotels and Euro hotels this was very good and did incl a good continental breakfast which was incl and many you pay extra. Bed hard but tolerable. We were only there to sleep at night and went sight seeing during day. This has location, location, location right off Las Ramblas. We rode the train from airport and took metro to hotel and walked with our luggage from metro to hotel. We planned to take the blue bus from Las Ramblas to the ship but never could find the stop so we walked with our luggage from hotel to the ship. Very long way. Would not advise this. Upon return we found the blue bus stop at the Columbus monument. You can't use your metro/train ticket on the blue bus. If you plan to sight see Barcelona either buy the tour bus ticket or buy a T10. The T 10 can be used on the train and metro and is good for an extended period of time. I'd stay again with them! Very thoughtful of their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Simple, great location”
Reviews.Author: MrOzzie
Reviews.Content: Great location in heart of Barri Gotic and 200 metres to Las Ramblas and Liceu metro station. It was basic with small rooms but that was what we expected given the price. Functional with decent breakfast, friendly staff and importantly no hiccups in any way. The location is the main selling point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: -Honey-32123
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week at the Hotel California in Barcelona. The hotel is in a great location, just off La Rambles and close to the Plaze Rieal. There are lots of bars, tapas bars, shops, museums, and places to eat near by. The staff at the hotel were great. They were very friendly and helpful. They greeted us with a smile every time we came in the door. The rooms are a decent size and the bathroom was great. Our bathroom had a sliding door with a small terrace off of it, which provided lots of natural light to the room. The room had a large closet with lots of shelves and hangers and A/C. It was clean and quiet. The only downfall was the very hard bed. The price of the room was 85 Euros a night, which included breakfast. Breakfast was standard with cereal, breads, coffee, tea, juice and hot chocolate. The long hours for breakfast (8-11) were great. This was by far the best room we stayed in on our trip (out of 4) and the best value as well. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Could do with a lift!”
Reviews.Author: MissWright36
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Holel California in June 2008, for four nights. I really like the location of this hotel - it's really close to Las Ramblas and the harbour is a short walk from the hotel. I think the best thing about this hotel is the location. We were put on the third floor and there is no lift. It was not easy to carry a suitcase up the winding staircases!! When we got to our room, our room was like an oven. There is an air conditioning unit in the rooms but even on full power, it does nothing to cool down the heat from the rooms. It was quite difficult to sleep as the rooms were very stuffy. The rooms themselves are a good size, as is the bathroom. No full length mirrors though and we only had one plug socket in our room. There is a small balcony overlooking the street below. Having said all that, this hotel has character and the staff are really nice. I would recommend it for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: NottinghamMargaret
Reviews.Content: I, & 8 other female work colleagues stayed at this hotel in April this year. We all found it excellent value for money in an ideal location being just off La Ramblas, clean, towels changed daily, shampoo and soap were provided. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast consisted of cornflakes or muesli, croissants, Danish pastries, small rolls, jams, etc, fruit juice, tea & coffee - what else do you need. The only negatives were that there was no lift, no long mirror in the bedroom and no hairdryer but we were told that the hotel is due to have some major work done soon that will address some of these issues. As I have said this is a brilliant hotel with wonderful staff who you can have a laugh with (especially "Prince" William) and we would all recommend anyone staying there. They have a safe at Reception for your valuables and they will keep your cases in Reception if you have a later flight. We booked a minibus to collect us from the airport and return through Resorthoppa.com which was a really good deal and would recommend this too - they were efficient and vigilant. The queues for taxis at the airport were very long. We bought a 2 day Touristic bus ticket which enables you to hop on and off as many times as you want but BEWARE of thieves, my friend had an attempted purse snatch out of her bag whilst we were waiting for one of these buses and we were told if this happens a good way is to draw attention to the fact by shouting loudly SHE'S A THIEF, which I did many times but no one in the queue batted an eyelid - the good news was that she gave my friend her purse back - just be wary and have any bags hanging on the front of you. You receive a booklet on the purchase of your ticket with various discounts in them. We used a voucher for the Pans chain for lunch one day which entitled you to 2 drinks, 2 hot or cold baguettes and a portion of chips which we thought was reasonable value for 8 euros. There are loads of tapas bars and every type of restaurant - just go and explore.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: LancashirePals
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights, booked via their website. Arrangements were excellent with e-mails (in English) being answered / actioned very quickly; they asked for a confirmation one week before arrival. Reception very helpful but be aware there is no lift to any of the 3 floors. We were offered a choice of rooms and settled for room 103 (double on first floor on corner of the property, at the front). The self-service Continental breakfast was plentiful (but no ham, cheese, yoghurt or fruit). The rooms were clean but they could do with a bit more 'tender loving care' and some basic investment / up-grade of the mattress, top sheets and furniture; hot water was always available. The hotel location is very good on a street off the Ramblas. Good Irish Bars locally (try Molly's Fair City) and try the Schilling Bar for coffeee & beer as some on the street were rip offs (especially one close to / on the same side as the Schilling offering tapas). Do not eat at the Compestella Restaurant on this street as they could not get you out of the place quick enough (you only got an apple for your sweet on the tourist menu for 16 Euros!). For a quick, cheap lunch or snack try the Pans chain of sandwich shops. The best way to see the city is the Official Tourist Bus, but do not expect anyone to be courteous and queue as they charge on and even laugh at you when you complain; also use the vouchers they give you on the bus for discounts to attractions and for food. The only complaint we had was about the noise in the street outside the hotel - do not expect a good night's sleep as locals were drinking cans of beer outside the hotel (just in the street) up to 5.00 a.m. each evening / morning. The hotel is supposed to be double glazed with air-conditioning - the first doesn't work as you can hear every word spoken / shouted, but at least the air conditioning did. I would not like to stay here in the main holiday period in the summer months. In summary, it is worth the money for what you get and where it is. We will not be returning to Barcelona and three days was enough to do what we wanted to do / see.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint And Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lmarkman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a good value considering that it is a block off the Ramblas, in the heart of a most interesting area, is in walking distance to many sites and transportation, and is in a city that is quite expensive. Our 98 Euros for a room with 2 single beds included breakfast and all taxes. The hotel is small, unpretensious and without a lift to the second floor. However, our basic room was spacious with everything in good working order, had been redone not too long ago, and was quite pleasant with a small balcony overlooking the narrow and busy street. The breakfast room was nice with an adequate number of tables and the food was basic (cereals, breads, pastries, juices, milk, coffee, tea, etc.). The staff were friendly and helpful and were available 24/7 at the desk. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lopey99
Reviews.Content: we're just back from 6 nights at the hotel, we had no major problems with it. It is quite easy to get to from the green line 3 Liceu metro stop. Once you come out of the metro station turn down the ramblas following the McDonalds signs, turn down the street with the KFC and McDonalds on both sides its about 100 yards down on the right. The street is called Carrier de Rauric or something similar and i must admit it does look a bit shabby but its safe enough. when we first arrived there looked to be a few homeless people on this street but this was the first and last time we saw them, the streets are washed down each night by the council so this probably acts as a deterrant. the hotel itself was basic but very clean, our rooms were cleaned on a daily basis whilst we were there. our double room was a little on the small side but for the little time we spent there it wasnt much of a problem. the bathroom was nicely decorated however there was a bit of mould and damp around the shower. satalite tv was provided however all of the channels except sky news were in spanish. breakfast wasnt great, cereal, croissants and other rolls were provided along with tea coffee and fruit juice but it was something to start your day off with. overall this hotel was satisfactory, the location was excellent and the staff were really helpful and friendly as well as all speaking really good english i would definitely recommend it, its not the ritz but you dont come to barcelona and spend a lot of time in your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: ClaritaLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located just off one of the main streets in the old town and close to Las Ramblas. Quite difficult to find initially however because it is down a side street. Room was clean and comfortable, and staff friendly. Breakfast could have done with a bit more choice though. A thoroughly enjoyable stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: ste1977
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a lovely stay at the California Hotel, Barcelona. Arrived at the main Barcelona airport with Easyjet. Its very easy to catch the Aerobus from outside the terminal building. This takes you directly to Placa Catalunya for 3.90 euro single taking around 30 minutes. The walk to the hotel from Placa Catalunya is around 10 minutes. Stayed in a twin bedded room from 19-25th May, 2007. The room rate included breakfast and was served from 07:00 until 11:00 daily. The breakfast is fairly basic but does offer juice, tea, coffee, breads and jam. This is a small hotel, very clean, the staff are friendly and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Paupy
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst 2 star hotels I have ever stayed in. We turned up to find that our double booking had somehow become a twin and that we couldn't move rooms until the next day. Then they switched us to what had to be the worst room in the whole building. The bathroom had obviously been painted and grouted recently and the fumes were overwhelming, even with the door shut. But worse was the shower itself, which had no hot water pressure - leaving us to shower under the barest trickle of water. Despite repeated requests nothing was done to fix the shower, move us to an alternative room or give us a discount on the room rate. The only saving grace was that we were just in Barcelona for a weekend and so spent most of the time out of the room. The hotel is in a great location, but there are other options nearby and quite frankly it would be worth paying a bit more to avoid this place. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Safe For Women”
Reviews.Author: SD29
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel California on 6 occasions while attending a language college and travelling on my own. The only way to enter the hotel is if you are let into the building by the desk staff. This means that you can be sure that people are not just wandering around in the building. This has always made me feel very safe. The desk staff are all wonderful and greet me like an old friend. The rooms and bathrooms are clean It can be noisy in the summer but is less so in the winter - in any case, the air-conditioning is very effective and, if used along with earplugs, will drown out the worst of the noise!! Breakfast is included in the price - there isn't that much choice but it is tasty and nicely presented. I love this hotel and am back there in 7 weeks - I can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot do better”
Reviews.Author: ricardohb
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Hotel California now for 13 years, in my humble opinion you cannot do better for the money. It is centrally situated, get the bus/underground/train from the airport to Plaza Catalunia and walk down the Ramblas towards the port. Just past the Liceu opera house and underground station on your left hand side is a street with a McDonalds on the one corner and a KFC on the other (dont be put off now though, read on). Walk up this street approx 100 yards and the street is on the right hand side, 20 yds down this very tiny street is this fabulous gem. Staff, service, service, cleanliness and security is seond to non, 24hr reception. Breakfast excellent value. Need any help....just ask and the staff will go out of their way. Enough of this babble, just book and go.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: al345sf
Reviews.Content: Hotel California is located in the Gothic Quarter. It's a great location just off of Placa Real and very close to Las Ramblas. There was a little bit of noisy, but it wasn't anything more than you can expect in a big city. I had no problems with it. I was concerned by some of the previous reviews and was prepared for the worst. I had decided to stay here, to save a little money which I was planning to spend on more upscale hotels at other stops during my visit to Spain. I was very pleasantly surprised. The room was larger and brighter than I had expected. I was really surprised by the size of the bathroom and tub/shower. This too was bigger than many I've had while travelling in Europe. Though the rooms were spartan, they were still clean and comfortable. The breakfast was plain with no variety. I think most Americans would be ok with it for a few days. After 3 days, I was ready for something new. There's no yogurt, hard-boiled eggs or fruit. This place is a great value for your money. It's clean and comfortable, and in a great location. I recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel California
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Rauric N0 14, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
